Name: To the Shore's End
QuestDesc: The future is still unknown, and the past remains buried beneath the waves. After your journey across Mt. Firmament, all clues now point to a hidden island in the sea—the Black Shores. Yangyang's message hints that in the Port City of Guixu, you might find the Bloom Bearer now stationed in Jinzhou...

Unlock.Name: Cerulean Echoes Adrift in the Winds: Part I

Chapters.Title: Head to the Port City of Guixu and meet with Yangyang

Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well, well! Look who I bumped into—a Midnight Ranger!

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ah! Rover, you're finally here...
So you're the Rover, huh? Delighted to make your acquaintance.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This is Youhu from Jinzhou. Like Mr. Chenpi, she's an expert in antiques.

Dialogues.Speaker: Youhu
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That's me!

Options.PlotLineKey: What brings an antiques expert here?

Dialogues.Speaker: Youhu
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: To uncover clues about hidden antiques, of course! Since Mt. Firmament reopened, Master and I noticed artifacts from there popping up in the market.

Dialogues.Speaker: Youhu
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Aside from Court of Savantae gadgets, there are still plenty of mystery items that don't exactly scream Mt. Firmament, ya know?

Dialogues.Speaker: Youhu
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So…

Options.PlotLineKey: So...

Dialogues.Speaker: Youhu
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So I'm betting they're from the Port City of Guixu!

Options.PlotLineKey: I received a message from Yangyang.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes, I remember you mentioned wanting to learn more about your past ties to the Black Shores.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The battle in Norfall Barrens is over, and the Black Shores should be withdrawing... but they've asked the Midnight Rangers to monitor the area around the Port City of Guixu.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I thought this might be your chance to gather more information about them...

Options.PlotLineKey: I'm touched you remember what I said.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ah!?

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You, er, brought it up before.

Dialogues.Speaker: Youhu
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Aw, Yangyang's got a soft spot for you, huh? Are you her SPECIAL someone?

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, come on. I-I just know it means a lot to you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Youhu
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Relax, I'm just teasing. So {PlayerName}, you're tracking the Black Shores too?

Options.PlotLineKey: I still have this Blake Bloom that Aalto gave me.
This should lead me to them, right?

Dialogues.Speaker: Youhu
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Since we're on the same trail, how about teaming up?

Dialogues.Speaker: Youhu
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let THIS master be your guide! You and me, dream team. Nothing is going to slow us down.

Options.PlotLineKey: That's a little dramatic, to say the least.

Dialogues.Speaker: Youhu
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Not to boast, but epic adventures tend to have a way of finding me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Since Rover's here, let's talk to that Bloom Bearer first.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yangyang has sent word that a Bloom Bearer from the Black Shores is currently in the Port City of Guixu and may have important information about your identity. Upon your arrival in the city, you happen to run into Chenpi's apprentice, Youhu…

Chapters.Title: Search for the Black Shores researcher

Dialogues.Speaker: Black Shores Member
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That's weird. These parameters are correct, but nothing's happening. What's going on…?

Options.PlotLineKey: Are you a Bloom Bearer from the Black Shores?

Dialogues.Speaker: Black Shores Member
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes. Need something?

Dialogues.Speaker: Black Shores Member
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh!? So… y-you're the one Aalto invited earlier?

Options.PlotLineKey: The one and only.

Dialogues.Speaker: Black Shores Member
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ohhh! Sorry I didn't recognize you!

Dialogues.Speaker: Black Shores Member
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Golden pupils and this Blake Bloom. Yeah, it's you alright!

Dialogues.Speaker: Niya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm Niya, a Bloom Bearer from the Black Shores. Didn't expect to meet someone as important as you under these circumstances...

Dialogues.Speaker: Niya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I know it's unusual, but… could you help me out now that we're working together?

Options.PlotLineKey: Hold on, I haven't decided if I want to join the Black Shores.

Dialogues.Speaker: Niya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Really? But Encore mentioned you'd be joining soon...

Options.PlotLineKey: Can you explain what's going on first?

Dialogues.Speaker: Niya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Actually, we're monitoring abnormal parameters and detected a problematic frequency that needs to be taken back to the Black Shores.

Dialogues.Speaker: Niya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Port City of Guixu was decimated by the Lament. If this frequency goes unchecked, it could trigger another catastrophe...

Options.PlotLineKey: Are the stakes really that high?

Dialogues.Speaker: Niya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes, that's why the Tethys System sent us to locate and recover this frequency as soon as possible, to prevent a potential disaster.

Dialogues.Speaker: Niya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Our agents relayed the coordinates, but...

Dialogues.Speaker: Niya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Since then, I've lost contact with them, which doesn't sit well... I'm stuck here monitoring, can't leave my post.

Dialogues.Speaker: Niya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Do you think you could help check out what happened?

Dialogues.Speaker: Niya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If things aren't looking good, we might need to inform Jinzhou's City Hall, like we did before.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We will need to act fast, then.

Dialogues.Speaker: Niya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That's the worst-case scenario. If we contain the frequency as the Tethys System advises, nothing bad will happen.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: {PlayerName}, I want to help her.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As an Outrider, it's my duty to safeguard the peace.

Options.PlotLineKey: Guess I'll take charge. No surprise there.
You're right. We can't just sit this out.

Dialogues.Speaker: Niya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thank you! It's reassuring to have a Midnight Ranger with us. I'll send you the coordinates of the abnormal frequency.

Options.PlotLineKey: By the way, what do you mean by "abnormal frequency"?

Dialogues.Speaker: Niya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Could be the Reverberations or something in the Sonoro Spheres.

Dialogues.Speaker: Niya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In Solaris, frequencies can be anything. One thing's for sure though, this frequency represents gravity.

Dialogues.Speaker: Niya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's abnormal because... it has its own gravitational center. You should be able to feel a palpable anomaly near it. That's how you can locate it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Niya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I trust you'll handle it smoothly. But remember, your safety matters most. Don't hesitate to retreat if you run into any real danger.

Dialogues.Speaker: Niya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And once you're back, we'll hurry to the Black Shores to upload it to the Tethys System… Oh! I forgot you haven't been to the Black Shores, have you?

Options.PlotLineKey: Not yet, at least.

Dialogues.Speaker: Niya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No worries. I'll be your guide then.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In the Port City of Guixu, you meet Niya, a Bloom Bearer who quickly recognizes you. She warns of an abnormal frequency detected in Guixu that must be urgently brought back to the Black Shores. If left unresolved, it might trigger another Lament…

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I sense the presence of Tacet Discords below.

Dialogues.Speaker: Youhu
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What's the big deal? Just some pawns. I won't even break a sweat.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Something feels... different about them. Be careful.

Dialogues.Speaker: Unknown Tacet Discord
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: R… Run…

Dialogues.Speaker: Unknown Tacet Discord
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The building collapsed…

Dialogues.Speaker: Unknown Tacet Discord
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They're all trapped… It's completely jammed…

Dialogues.Speaker: Blurred Figure
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The new Final Fancy Defense comes out tomorrow.

Dialogues.Speaker: Blurred Figure
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ugh, still have to wait a week to get my shell credits…

Dialogues.Speaker: Blurred Figure
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Mommy, when's the next subway?

Dialogues.Speaker: Blurred Figure
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, sweetheart, it's just ten minutes away. It won't be long.

Dialogues.Speaker: Blurred Figure
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Grandpa and Grandma are making your favorite dishes.

Dialogues.Speaker: Blurred Figure
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They're too short-sighted to spare a glance at the stars above.

Dialogues.Speaker: Blurred Figure
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Those who don't revere the stars will eventually fade into history.

Dialogues.Speaker: Blurred Figure
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh my… Where's my pocket watch?

Dialogues.Speaker: Blurred Figure
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: …Oh, I sent it for repairs yesterday.

Dialogues.Speaker: Blurred Figure
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: How come I forgot something from just yesterday?

Dialogues.Speaker: Youhu
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What…

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Look for survivors, quick!

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's… too late.

Dialogues.Speaker: Youhu
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So, they're the agents Niya was waiting for...

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What happened here…
Welcome.
Astral Modulator, the Rover {Male=himself;Female=herself}. We have awaited this reunion for a long time.

Options.PlotLineKey: We?

Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes… WE.
We are the gravitational force you seek.
Time... is running out. Hoda. My name is Hoda.
This is MY name. I once lived under it… as a Bloom Bearer.

Options.PlotLineKey: Is this your doing with the Bloom Bearers?

Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Heh heh, "you"? Which one of us are you talking to? Men or women, elders or children?
Do you hear the echoes of our "lament"?
Remember… Remember it all…
Remember your past, the past you turned your back on… The past as one of the Black Shores...
And respond... respond to the promises you made, to the future we're bound to share.
Salvation... is forging a world where saving is no longer needed.
No, no! They want you to become a part of them. I can't let it happen.
Run! RUN! {PlayerName}!
What you seek… is on the girl…
She has it...

Dialogues.Speaker: Youhu
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Eugh! What does any of this have to do with me?!

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Where did it go? No, wait. Don't go over there, {PlayerName}!

Options.PlotLineKey: It claimed it was the gravitational center we're looking for.
It must be the abnormal frequency the Black Shores want recovered.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The remaining frequency there is in extreme chaos. It's dangerous.

Dialogues.Speaker: Youhu
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hold on! Hey, what's happening?! It's starting to glow!

Dialogues.Speaker: Youhu
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It must be from the Black Shores! Look at this!

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A mysterious object pulses with rhythmic light, seemingly harboring some form of frequency.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Upon arriving at the coordinates provided by Niya, you find the bodies of several Black Shores members who have died under mysterious circumstances. There, you encounter a mysterious Bloom Bearer named Hoda, who claims to know about your past but cannot divulge the details. Before disappearing, Hoda directs you to Youhu for further clues...

Dialogues.Speaker: Youhu
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I need to learn more about this thing. My master and I guessed it's from the Black Shores, and now it looks like we were right!

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The abnormal frequency definitely links to the deaths of those Bloom Bearers.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Now it's hiding in this object, but I can still feel its strong attachment to the Black Shores.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Solving this issue is beyond our capabilities. Besides, they also mentioned Rover and the fall of the Port City of Guixu.

Dialogues.Speaker: Youhu
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We should meet with that Bloom Bearer first and explain the situation. This is best left to the experts.

Options.PlotLineKey: You're right. We need to keep her informed.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let's go, {PlayerName}. I've a bad feeling about this.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I sense there's more to this than meets the eye…

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Port City of Guixu must hold secrets waiting to be discovered.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As the group moves forward, Yangyang informs the Midnight Rangers of the situation and begins preparations to recover the Bloom Bearers' bodies...

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Youhu reveals that the clue Hoda mentioned is an artifact from Mt. Firmament, discovered by her and Master Chenpi. Now, it seems connected with the Black Shores. The frequency tied to Hoda is hidden within this artifact, and it seems linked to the deaths of the Bloom Bearers. Reporting this matter to Niya and the Black Shores is now a matter of urgency.

Chapters.Title: Investigate the surrounding and report to Niya
Investigate the anomaly under the bridge

Dialogues.Speaker: Youhu
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Whoa!

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thanks…

Dialogues.Speaker: Youhu
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Huh? Up there!
Welcome home.
The wandering traveler… {PlayerName}…
At last, you have returned…
Here, the story both ends and begins anew.
I am pleased to see you back on these shores.
Wherever you venture, be it Huanglong or Rinascita, I will always be here, waiting.
No matter how far you wander, you will always find me here... on these black shores.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As you traverse the Sonoro Sphere, you finally arrive at your true beginnings. Yet, the person who waits here remains beyond your grasp…

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Phew, finally out of the cave.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But why is the fog still so thick? I can't even see you!
Because you're at Veiled Rock, your vision is veiled. Now, how about explaining what brings you here, uninvited guests?

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Wh-what…!? {PlayerName}!?

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Is it really you? No, no, don't let this be a dream… At last! You've come to me, to the Black Shores!

Options.PlotLineKey: Wait, what? This is the Black Shores?

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Precisely.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But how did you manage to get here?

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You recount to Aalto the events that led to your arrival here.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I see… Tsk, the situation doesn't look good.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That Hoda might not be one of us.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But I'm curious... could I have a look at that item the antique dealer gave you?

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You hand the antique Youhu gave you over to Aalto.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Huh, didn't expect to see it outside Mt. Firmament…

Options.PlotLineKey: You know what it is?

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A monitoring register. We, Black Shores members, place these around the world to keep an eye on the Sentinels. If anything happens to them, we'll know immediately.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Looks like it was also used to record abnormal frequencies in the Port City of Guixu…

Options.PlotLineKey: But why was I teleported here?

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Maybe the Tethys System has a soft spot for you? But without more details, I can't say for sure.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Since your arrival, has anything unusual caught your eye?

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You tell Aalto about the person you met on the beach…

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A person in light blue… Could it be the Shorekeeper?

Options.PlotLineKey: The Shorekeeper?

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes, the elusive guardian of the Black Shores, who is said to be always watching our true leader, shielding us from danger. It seems you've had quite the encounter.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In times of great adversity, the Shorekeeper will reveal herself and support our true leader, who, at the destined moment, will rise to save and guide the Black Shores. Fantastical or not, that's all we've got to go on.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: There must be a reason she went to such lengths for you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ahem... Anyway, let's not get carried away. We should head to the Greenhouse. The abnormal frequency you collected needs to be uploaded to the Tethys System as soon as possible in order to avoid another Lament in the Port City of Guixu.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Given that we've already lost enough of our own to it, we need more Bloom Bearers to handle this.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As for the information you're after—

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's already spread this far…

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Seems like the Tethys malfunction is getting worse.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We need to hurry. Time is one luxury we do not have. Let's save the rest for the road.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Passing through the mist, you encounter Aalto on patrol. After you recount your recent experience, he speculates that the blue figure you just saw might be the Shorekeeper from the Black Shores. However, the immediate priority is to upload the abnormal frequency to the Tethys System for analysis. Meanwhile, the Black Shores seem to be grappling with certain anomalies...

Chapters.Title: Head to the headquarters of the Black Shores
Head to the headquarters of the Black Shores

Dialogues.Speaker: Youhu
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hey! Can you hear me! Is that you, Rover? Are you okay?!

Dialogues.Speaker: Youhu
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We couldn't reach you for so long! Yangyang was freaking out!

Dialogues.Speaker: Youhu
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Someone must have teleported us away from the Port City of Guixu when things went south.

Dialogues.Speaker: Youhu
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You know, in the blink of an eye, we were back in Jinzhou.

Dialogues.Speaker: Youhu
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hey, is that the sea behind you?

Dialogues.Speaker: Youhu
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What? Ro...ver...

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Comm's dead? Don't worry. It happens a lot around here.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Black Shores sits atop a massive Tacetite, wreaking havoc on standard communications.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Once we reach the Greenhouse, you can patch them in near our beacon.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Only our beacons can cut through the Tacetite's interference.

Chapters.Title: Search for the robot that can upload the data

Dialogues.Speaker: KU-Money
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ku ku ku…

Dialogues.Speaker: KU-Money
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Aalto? I've told you before, when it comes to the classic games on the TR-1200, you don't stand a chance against me. Not in the slightest!

Options.PlotLineKey: Is that... a talking robot?

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well, in a sense, yes. They're directly linked to the Tethys System, their voice frequencies are encoded into languages we could understand. If you think about it, they could be considered a unique living race of their own.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As for the Tethys System, imagine it as a supercomputer. The Black Shores relies on its calculations to observe, forewarn, and solve anything Lament-related.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Anyway... let me introduce you to KU-Money. They manage the cash flow and keep tabs on robot terminals across the region. They're the shrewd profiteer of the Black Shores.

Dialogues.Speaker: KU-Money
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yo, hold up! You can't call me that! Every move I make is about stacking those chips for the Black Shores!

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Easy there. Let's get back to business.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The recent quake's stirred up Tacetite's interference. How's your underground connection holding?

Dialogues.Speaker: KU-Money
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Rock solid. As long as Tethys is up, we're wired tight.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That's comforting. Hey {PlayerName}, you can give the abnormal frequency to KU-Money. They'll handle the upload.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You hand over the card Youhu gave you to the peculiar robot.

Dialogues.Speaker: KU-Money
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This a new rookie? You've got skills if you snagged that abnormal frequency from Port City of Guixu. Better not underestimate you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: How's the upload? Already sent the data back to Tethys?

Dialogues.Speaker: KU-Money
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yeah, all done.

Dialogues.Speaker: KU-Money
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What's going on, Aalto? I never see you this serious.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Tethys System has been shaky lately. You've noticed, right.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What's worse, along with the data, we received some terrible news. The Bloom Bearers we sent to the Port City of Guixu… We lost them all.

Dialogues.Speaker: KU-Money
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: H-how did that happen!?

Dialogues.Speaker: KU-Money
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What happened in that city…

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Since you're linked to the Tethys' data bank, can you check if there's a Bloom Bearer named Hoda registered?

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: She might have something to do with the deaths of our people.

Options.PlotLineKey: She seems to be able to control gravity.
She referred to herself as a "we."

Dialogues.Speaker: KU-Money
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A Bloom Bearer whose Forte is controlling gravity… I've checked all records of both Resonators and Bloom Bearers, but I didn't find anyone matching your description.

Dialogues.Speaker: KU-Money
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I haven't heard of anyone with such an ability either.

Dialogues.Speaker: KU-Money
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Gravity control? Sounds farfetched. I'd sooner believe in someone minting Shell Credits.

Options.PlotLineKey: Unlikely that exists in any universe.
Keep me posted if you find one.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well, it's a big world, after all. Since we already know someone who can resonate with the Sentinel… you never know.

Dialogues.Speaker: KU-Money
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Sure thing! We can split the Shell Credits they generate, 30-70. I'll take the 70, you take the 30. That's the deal!

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Says Mr. Cheapskate!

Dialogues.Speaker: KU-Money
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, almost forgot.

Dialogues.Speaker: KU-Money
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Here, take this!

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: KU-Money takes out a large sum of money…

Options.PlotLineKey: Uh, sorry?

Dialogues.Speaker: KU-Money
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Each Black Shores member is allocated a specific fund, and this is yours. Find me when you burn through it all.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That's not fair. You've never given me that much before!

Dialogues.Speaker: KU-Money
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I deducted the money you lost to me in games. It was all you had left!

Dialogues.Speaker: KU-Money
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, by the way! Are you heading to the Greenhouse?

Dialogues.Speaker: KU-Money
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If a Bloom Bearer dies outside the Black Shores, we bring their body back and keep Monica in the loop.

Dialogues.Speaker: KU-Money
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, we need to send out a warning as usual. There's still a lot to do...

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: KU-Money is right. Just in case, the Tethys System is very likely to send out a warning to Jinzhou about an imminent Lament in the Port City of Guixu.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As for Hoda... If she's a Bloom Bearer, there should be a record of her in the system. And if such a Resonator existed, the Black Shores would definitely know.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hold on. There's another possibility…

Options.PlotLineKey: She's not from the Black Shores?

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yeah, that's one possibility. Not to worry, if the machine route doesn't work, there's another way...

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let's go to the Greenhouse. Most of us like to gather there, and Monica, our chief administrator, is stationed there as well.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You hand over the data to the specialized robot at the Black Shores, which swiftly uploads it into the Tethys System. The merchant known as KU-Money, perhaps mistaking you as one of their own, rewards you with a substantial sum of money. However, despite its extensive knowledge of the Black Shores, the robot knows nothing of Hoda's true identity.

Dialogues.Speaker: Monica
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Aalto, there you are. And this is…?

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Rover just arrived. {Male=He;Female=She} is the one we invited earlier—the mysterious Resonator who appeared in Jinzhou.

Dialogues.Speaker: Monica
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So you're the Resonator who confronted the Threnodian? I honestly didn't expect to meet you in person!

Dialogues.Speaker: Monica
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ahem, sorry, I got a bit carried away. My name's Monica, the chief administrator—or "housekeeper" around here.

Dialogues.Speaker: Monica
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I was supposed to show you around, but things are quite hectic right now. My apologies.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You heard about what happened in Guixu, right?

Dialogues.Speaker: Monica
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes, we received word from Jinzhou's City Hall about their actions. We also alerted them to the Tethys System's likely warning of a potential Lament in the Port City of Guixu.

Dialogues.Speaker: Monica
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The data you brought back has been uploaded to the system, but as you know, Tethys has been unstable.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So the problem isn't solved.

Dialogues.Speaker: Monica
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Exactly. We need Tethys functioning normally to fully resolve this.

Dialogues.Speaker: Monica
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But retrieving the abnormal frequency was a significant step forward.

Dialogues.Speaker: Monica
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Those Bloom Bearers didn't sacrifice themselves in vain…

Dialogues.Speaker: Monica
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It could have been much worse if they hadn't risked their lives to transmit the coordinates back to Niya. And thank you for risking your life to retrieve the data.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What's the current situation?

Dialogues.Speaker: Monica
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Efforts to stabilize the Tethys System are underway.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Good to hear. By the way, since you deal with all our contacts, does the name "Hoda" ring any bells? She claims to be a Bloom Bearer.

Dialogues.Speaker: Monica
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hoda? No, I don't recall any Bloom Bearer by that name. Why do you ask?

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You tell Monica what happened in the Port City of Guixu…

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You meet Monica, the chief administrator of the Black Shores, and discover that the Tethys System has been experiencing instability. You then brief her on the recent events in the Port City of Guixu.

Dialogues.Speaker: Monica
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So, this is related to that abnormal frequency…

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Maybe she's a traitor.

Dialogues.Speaker: Monica
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That theory doesn't hold water. Not only are traitors incredibly rare in our history, they are all documented.

Dialogues.Speaker: Monica
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And there's no record of her in the system. Was she trying to mislead us?

Options.PlotLineKey: She told me I was once part of the Black Shores.

Dialogues.Speaker: Monica
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmm, that's strange, because we just added you to the recruitment list recently.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: She's quite the mystery... Monica, can you try to gather more info about this Hoda for us?

Dialogues.Speaker: Monica
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Of course. If it concerns the security of the Black Shores, it's my job.

Dialogues.Speaker: Monica
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If this... "person" was truly residing in that abnormal frequency, "she" could be responsible for those deaths.

Options.PlotLineKey: If she was residing in that abnormal frequency…
Did we just upload it to…?

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: —Damn it, we've been tricked. We just fed it back into Tethys!

Dialogues.Speaker: Monica
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Careful!

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well, looks like she's made herself at home in Tethys.

Dialogues.Speaker: Monica
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'll check with KU-Money to assess the current situation underground. We need to do everything in our power to protect Tethys from any harm.

Dialogues.Speaker: Monica
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: {PlayerName}, could you please accompany Aalto to the Greenhouse? We need you to find the KU-Water robots.

Dialogues.Speaker: Monica
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Also, ensure the Modulation Device in the Greenhouse remains secure.

Dialogues.Speaker: Monica
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: …I'm sorry. You were meant to have a pleasant time here…

Dialogues.Speaker: Monica
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: When the dust clears, I'd like to formally welcome you to join us.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Even Monica, the chief administrator of the Black Shores, has never heard of the name Hoda. Right after your discussion, another quake shakes the Black Shores, echoing the disaster in the Port City of Guixu. To safeguard the Tethys System, Monica instructs you to inspect the Modulation Device in the Greenhouse.

Chapters.Title: Contact the others at the beacon

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: …{PlayerName}! Finally got through…

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hey, you scared us to death!!!

Options.PlotLineKey: Sorry, the Tacetite's interference was too strong.
I'm in the Black Shores now.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Glad to know you're all right.

Options.PlotLineKey: Chixia, is that you?

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yeah! Just so you know, we got the Black Shores' warning, so we cranked up the defenses in Jinzhou.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Midnight Rangers are preparing to secure the Port City of Guixu, and…

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As for the Bloom Bearers who have passed, we'll bring their bodies back to the Black Shores.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I know the Black Shores hold many answers for you—your memories, your past…

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Though the road ahead is uncertain, I hope you find the truth you seek.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And please remember, you never have to bear the weight alone... I... We are here with you. Always.

Chapters.Title: Head to the highest point in the Greenhouse
Head to the highest point in the Greenhouse
Head to the highest point in the Greenhouse
Head to the highest point in the Greenhouse

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The island is quiet and serene.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It appears these islands have deliberately formed a circle, leaving a void in the center.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hey, what's on your mind?

Options.PlotLineKey: Can robots grow a desire for money, too?

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You ever play those RPGs? Each character's got a backstory, right? Well, these robots are no different.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Tethys System gives them all their own personalities. Take KU-Money, for instance. Tethys programmed it to be a crafty dealmaker.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Who knows, maybe one day you'll come across a robot you really click with.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Once you're ready, we'll head over to the Greenhouse and meet Monica.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Grrr…

Options.PlotLineKey: I thought an intel broker like you always stays cool-headed.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm frustrated with myself. Got too carried away by your presence to think straight.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I thought we could easily resolve that issue by uploading the data you brought back to the system. Never considered the possibility of an infiltrator lurking inside.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We need to figure out who's behind all this.

Options.PlotLineKey: Does the Tethys System mean that much to the Black Shores?

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yeah, the Black Shores' every move hinges on its decisions, big or small. Without Tethys, it'd just be a barren Tacetite.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And if you're after the truth, you'll need its assistance too.

Options.PlotLineKey: What should I do now?

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Actually, KU-Money, Monica, and I don't have top clearance to the Tethys System. Our access is limited.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: With higher clearance, you could uncover the answers you're looking for…

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Alright, let's pick up the pace. We need to find the KU-Water siblings and check on the Modulation Device.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This is your chance to ask anything you want.

Options.PlotLineKey: Really?

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If anyone has answers, it's Tethys.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I can't guarantee you'll get everything you're after, but it's worth a shot, right?

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Greenhouse's just ahead. Let's move.

Dialogues.Speaker: KU-Water
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Lalala, happy watering…

Dialogues.Speaker: KU-Plant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Grow and bloom, my sweet little flowers…

Dialogues.Speaker: KU-Water
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ahh! Don't sneak up on me like that!

Options.PlotLineKey: Are you watering the flowers?

Dialogues.Speaker: KU-Water
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Of course! As a capable Gardener, I always give ultimate care to all these flowers.

Dialogues.Speaker: KU-Plant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Planting, watering, pruning, airing, and giving them sunshine!

Options.PlotLineKey: ...So, where's the Modulation Device?

Dialogues.Speaker: KU-Water
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Upstairs! See that piano? That's the Modulation Device.

Dialogues.Speaker: KU-Plant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, hold on! Please plant a flower.

Options.PlotLineKey: What?

Dialogues.Speaker: KU-Water
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Plant-A-Flower!

Dialogues.Speaker: KU-Water
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In the Black Shores, each member plants a flower here. Most choose flower seeds from their hometown.

Options.PlotLineKey: What flower did Aalto plant?
What flower did Encore plant?
What flower did Camellya plant?

Dialogues.Speaker: KU-Water
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmm... Aalto didn't plant a flower but a tree. A money tree, I remember…

Dialogues.Speaker: KU-Water
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I forget, but Encore didn't bring a seed from her hometown.

Dialogues.Speaker: KU-Water
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Camellya? She planted so many! Countless. She created an entire garden of flowers…

Dialogues.Speaker: KU-Plant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So, what kind of flower seed would you like to plant from your hometown?

Options.PlotLineKey: My hometown? I don't remember where I'm from.

Dialogues.Speaker: KU-Water
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Um… So you're a wandering traveler, right? Then a Blake Bloom would probably suit you well.

Options.PlotLineKey: A Blake Bloom?

Dialogues.Speaker: KU-Plant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Of course! Even if you don't remember your hometown, the Black Shores can be your new home. The Blake Blooms we give each member symbolize that!

Options.PlotLineKey: I belong here...?

Dialogues.Speaker: KU-Plant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yeah, you could say that… Um?!

Dialogues.Speaker: KU-Plant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Wait! KU-Water, are you feeling that? You... you're getting the same feeling, right?

Dialogues.Speaker: KU-Water
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmm, yeah… You look familiar, but I can't remember where we met...

Dialogues.Speaker: KU-Water
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Request… Request… No response.

Dialogues.Speaker: KU-Water
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But the Tethys System reacted to your face...

Dialogues.Speaker: KU-Plant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ohhh!!!

Options.PlotLineKey: What?!

Dialogues.Speaker: KU-Plant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Strange. I found a record of you in the system, but it suddenly disappeared...

Dialogues.Speaker: KU-Plant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What happened? Why did Tethys suddenly tell us to leave... Alright, let's go, KU-Water. KU-Money is waiting for us.

Dialogues.Speaker: KU-Water
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: O-okay. See you next time!

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Under the instruction of the Tethys System, the two robots leave.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It seems like the Tethys System is hiding something from you…

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: However, KU-Water and KU-Plant have already departed. Your best course of action now is to inspect the Modulation Device.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In the Greenhouse, you encounter two robots that recognize you as the lone Rover of Solaris. They speak of Blake Blooms as if you share a connection with them, but it appears that the Tethys System is somehow restraining them from revealing the truth of your identity…

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This piano is playing by itself.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmm? Do you know how to play the piano?

Options.PlotLineKey: No. It's doing that all by itself.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I guess the Black Shores have earned their mysterious reputation. They even have a self-playing piano.

Options.PlotLineKey: (Try to touch a key)

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The piano seems to respond to your touch.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So you do know how to play!

Options.PlotLineKey: (Keep touching the keys)

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I don't have a musical bone in me, but that sounded good.

Options.PlotLineKey: It sounds familiar.
(Keep touching the keys)

Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In every sound and frequency lies an emotion.
Just like this, expressing what's on your mind through music…
It's something even you can do. You'll give it a try, won't you?

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hey! Wake up! What was that?

Options.PlotLineKey: Did I just see...?

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ugh, what? It's just been the two of us here this whole time!

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ah! Another earthquake!

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What's happening? Run! We need to get out of here!

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A strange piano, known as the Modulation Device, plays its notes unbidden, offering fleeting glimpses of the past through sound and frequency. As you and Abby dive deeper into these reveries, a violent tremor shatters the moment…

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hey {PlayerName}, can you hear me?

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: There was a spike in the anchor frequency of the Tethys algorithmic array. It caused other abnormal frequencies to escape.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Analysts are still investigating. We're already en route for repairs.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Right now, the data stored in Tethys is materializing by drawing energy from the massive Tacetite beneath the Black Shores. It's making digital constructs out of real life entities.

Dialogues.Speaker: Monica
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: KU-Money already logged your info in Tethys. Now you can command the robots across the Black Shores to fix and upload the corrupted data. That'll restore the anchors.

Dialogues.Speaker: Monica
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We're heading to Veiled Rock's anchor. Rover, can you help at the Haven of Sprouts? It's our comms hub.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'll be helping with the repair at Veiled Rock. Such a pity I won't be there to witness Jinzhou's savior in action once more.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No... I'll miss seeing my friend in action again.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Maybe that's why you saw the other you in that vision?

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I… I'm so sleepy…

Chapters.Title: Head to the Haven of Sprouts
Restore the Anchor at the Haven of Sprouts
Anchor at the Haven of Sprouts restored
Head to the Eye of Asteria
Restore the Anchor at the Eye of Asteria
Anchor at the Eye of Asteria restored

Dialogues.Speaker: Monica
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The TD Observatory is where we observe Tacet Discords across the world to predict the Lament.

Dialogues.Speaker: Monica
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It handles data collection, storage, and transmission of anything related to these creatures.

Dialogues.Speaker: Monica
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That's why this place is the trickiest… We had a severe leak in data.

Dialogues.Speaker: Monica
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You'd better find the robot first. It's familiar with this place. The observatory keeper should know where to find it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhenjian
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Watch out! More Tacet Discords incoming!

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhenjian
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thank you. I'm the keeper of the TD Observatory.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhenjian
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That was an impressive battle, I've heard about your skills from my colleagues in Jinzhou.

Options.PlotLineKey: You're from Huanglong?

Dialogues.Speaker: Zhenjian
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes, but regardless of our origins, we're united by a common ideal here.

Chapters.Title: Restore the Anchor at the TD Observatory

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The last batch of corrupted data has been cleansed in the TD Observatory.
...Gorges of Spirits.
I can only go as far as you commanded.
From the Etheric Sea to Sonoro, from time to space…

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hey, Yangyang, look! Somebody's over there!

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Wait... is {Male=he;Female=she} dead or just unconscious?
Your story… begins here.
Go forth. I am forever by your side.

Dialogues.Speaker: KU-Key
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Whoa! You scared me. You just fell from above all of a sudden!

Dialogues.Speaker: KU-Key
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Are you alright?

Dialogues.Speaker: KU-Key
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I've got some spare parts and oil here. Take them all!

Options.PlotLineKey: Thank you, but I'm good…

Dialogues.Speaker: KU-Key
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The anchor in the TD Observatory has been restored now.

Dialogues.Speaker: KU-Key
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Aalto and the others have finished repairing the anchor at Veiled Rock too, and they'll be here soon!

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: With the Anchor at the TD Observatory restored, a true frequency rises from the depths, bringing a voice to your mind. It reveals that your awakening in the Gorges of Spirits was no mere coincidence. Before Yangyang found you, a mysterious figure had been watching your every move...

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The last batch of corrupted data has been cleansed in the TD Observatory.
...Gorges of Spirits.
I can only go as far as you commanded.
From the Etheric Sea to Sonoro, from time to space…

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hey, Yangyang, look! Somebody's over there!

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Wait... is {Male=he;Female=she} dead or just unconscious?
Your story… begins here.
Go forth. I am forever by your side.

Dialogues.Speaker: KU-Key
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Whoa! You scared me. You just fell from above all of a sudden!

Dialogues.Speaker: KU-Key
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Are you alright?

Dialogues.Speaker: KU-Key
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I've got some spare parts and oil here. Take them all!

Options.PlotLineKey: Thank you, but I'm good…

Dialogues.Speaker: KU-Key
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The anchor in the TD Observatory has been restored now.

Dialogues.Speaker: KU-Key
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Aalto and the others have finished repairing the anchor at Veiled Rock too, and they'll be here soon!

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: All right! All the repairs are finally done.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thank you for your help, {PlayerName}.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Without you leading the charge, we would have barely made it—

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You are… Hoda.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, I forgot to tell you. We finally found out her true identity.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: She wasn't lying when she said she was a Bloom Bearer. She worked as a field medic.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But more importantly, she died in the Lament that destroyed the Port City of Guixu a few hundred years ago.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In short, she couldn't be alive.

Options.PlotLineKey: Then how is any of this possible?

Dialogues.Speaker: Hoda
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hoda is but one of us. In the Tethys System, our registered name is… Necrostar.

Dialogues.Speaker: Hoda
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We are forever trapped on the event horizon of the black hole, falling into an unending darkness…

Dialogues.Speaker: Hoda
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Beneath the Lament's wheels we are but dust, pitiful souls cursed to suffer dreadful eternity, denied the solace of death.

Dialogues.Speaker: Hoda
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: My mentor… the one I follow…

Dialogues.Speaker: Hoda
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Please… I beg you to end this Möbius loop, this endless cycle...

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Welcome home, {PlayerName}.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: With all restorations complete, you scarcely have a moment to rest before the enigmatic Bloom Bearer Hoda reappears, addressing you as the mentor she has been following. Shortly after, the Shorekeeper herself emerges, welcoming your return…

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You stand on these shores once more. Welcome home, {PlayerName}.

Options.PlotLineKey: You saved me back in the Port City of Guixu?

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I wished to keep you from any harm.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Forgive me for acting on my own accord.

Options.PlotLineKey: Was that you on the beach before?
Why do you look sad?

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Sad? Pardon me, such emotions are not mine to show…

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes, it was I.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Long ago, when you first brought the Black Shores into existence on this island, I assisted you in managing this place.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You once wove the threads of this world together, but then you left, roving the boundaries between this realm and the next.

Options.PlotLineKey: I don't remember any of this…

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You have lost far more than just your memories.

Options.PlotLineKey: But the Black Shores...

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Since your departure, the Tethys System has been the sole leader of the Black Shores.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Most have never seen you, and that is all by your design.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This place, built by your hands, holds all its resources at your disposal.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You have more important matters to attend to than dealing with everyday trifles. That is why you entrusted the Tethys System with the Black Shores' governance.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This time, only you have the ability to end all of this. Completely.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This is also your first step towards the future.

Options.PlotLineKey: Hoda said something similar.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You mean…

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You tell the Shorekeeper what happened in the Port City of Guixu.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: She was indeed a Bloom Bearer, but mysteries still surround her and the departed.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The departed, whom you saw in the Port City of Guixu, caused those abnormal frequencies. Only you can mend those errors.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Rest assured, I shall always be by your side, to assist you as before.

Options.PlotLineKey: What happened back then…?

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I am sorry, but I must keep this secret from you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Perhaps, as you restore the Tethys System, you will uncover the reasons for severing ties with your past…

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Wandering traveler, please tell me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Are you satisfied with your journey and stories in Jinzhou?

Options.PlotLineKey: The people in Jinzhou are nice.
I'd say it's been a good start to the adventure.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Is that so? I'm glad to hear that.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In Solaris, Jinzhou is but the beginning of your journey.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Please, have faith. The path ahead shall be as splendid as you desire.

Options.PlotLineKey: What should I do now?

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The gate to the underground has been opened. Pass through it, and you will reach the depths of the Black Shores.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Your journey has only just begun.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Beyond the Black Shores lies Solaris itself.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Before you go, can I ask a favor?

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: When all is settled, will you share your stories from Jinzhou with me?

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Shorekeeper explains that during your absence, she and the Tethys System had taken over the running of the Black Shores. She confirms that it was indeed she who saved you, Yangyang, and Youhu in the Port City of Guixu. To address the threats posed by Hoda and the looming crisis in both the Black Shores and the Port City of Guixu, the Shorekeeper requests that you venture underground, to where the starry sky awaits...

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: She's the Shorekeeper.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: She even showed up in person. That means…

Options.PlotLineKey: You haven't met her before?

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I haven't seen the Shorekeeper in all my time in the Black Shores. I've only heard the stories about her.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If the Shorekeeper is revealing herself to you, it can only mean one thing. I think you know what I mean.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The gateway to the underground has been opened. I'm sure the answers lie ahead.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Go ahead. Leave the rest to us, buddy.

Dialogues.Speaker: KU-Nana
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Th-thank goodness, you're finally awake! I-I thought you fell so hard th-that you wouldn't be able to make it…

Options.PlotLineKey: Where am I?
Who are you?

Dialogues.Speaker: KU-Nana
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Y-you're at the Bank of Life. As you can see, i-it's an underground seed bank.

Dialogues.Speaker: KU-Nana
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: M-me? I-I am KU-Nana, an underground Gardener. I-I take care of the flowers here.

Options.PlotLineKey: So I'm already in the underground area, huh?

Dialogues.Speaker: KU-Nana
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Y-yes…

Dialogues.Speaker: KU-Nana
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Usually, no one comes to the Bank of Life except the Shorekeeper…

Options.PlotLineKey: Where is the Shorekeeper?

Dialogues.Speaker: KU-Nana
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmm, as far as I can remember, she seems to have never left this place.

Dialogues.Speaker: KU-Nana
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: She used to come to the Bank of Life once in a while, choosing a flower to plant in her own "garden." But she hasn't come for a very, very long time.

Dialogues.Speaker: KU-Nana
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: To be exact, it's been twenty years, five months, and seventeen days since her last visit.

Options.PlotLineKey: I need to fix Tethys' errors.

Dialogues.Speaker: KU-Nana
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Then you need to go to the Data Hub where the Stellar Matrices... I mean collections of stars are stored. Unfortunately, it's been out of commission for a while now.

Dialogues.Speaker: KU-Nana
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Shorekeeper has probably been too busy trying to fix it to visit.

Dialogues.Speaker: KU-Nana
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If the Shorekeeper places her trust in you, then y-you shall have our trust too.

Options.PlotLineKey: Thank you for trusting me.

Dialogues.Speaker: KU-Nana
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: KU-Money shared your information with us through the Tethys System.

Dialogues.Speaker: KU-Nana
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I only know how to take care of plants, and I can't do much in this situation… but I still want to help if the Black Shores, my home, is in crisis!

Options.PlotLineKey: I'll give it to the Shorekeeper.

Dialogues.Speaker: KU-Nana
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thank you so much!

Dialogues.Speaker: KU-Nana
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Go straight ahead, and you'll leave the Bank of Life!

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This door appears to be locked for some reason.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We probably need to locate a key to get it open from this side.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This plant is obviously well looked after.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Black Shores were constructed on a huge Tacetite rock, and most plants can only thrive in specific conditions.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Are these plants also cared for by the robots?

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The sign says, "Camellya 72973, recorded in the Bank of Life's Plant Archive."

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Is that truly a flower planted by Camellya?

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Based on the numbers, she's collected numerous flower species.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Despite having thousands, she appears to be searching for one irreplaceable flower.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This place is home to many plants, some familiar to Jinzhou and some new.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It feels almost like a botanical preserve.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Is it the cradle of a new world or the relic of an old one?

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This is what the Black Shores really looks like.

Options.PlotLineKey: You're just a projection, right?

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: To be exact, my body is composed of Sonoro Spheres, and the projection you see is but a shadow of the Sonoro.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I cannot leave my post. As the core computational unit of the Tethys System, I must remain to ensure its proper functioning.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yet, I still wish to be with you. This is the only way.

Options.PlotLineKey: Seeing a sky like this down here is a real surprise.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This place holds records of every Lament across Solaris—those that have passed, those happening now, and those yet to come.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Here, a planet's Lament transforms into stars that fill the sky.

Options.PlotLineKey: Hoda called me the "Astral Modulator."
Does that name have something to do with this place?

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Astral Modulator, Guide of Civilizations, Mastermind of the Black Shores…

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Before you severed ties with your past, it was indeed one of your names.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Perhaps you have a preference?

Options.PlotLineKey: What did you call me?

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Me…?

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I would call you by your true name, {PlayerName}.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I have always addressed you as such. In the past and present, through countless years.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That is the Necrostar, once known in ancient astronomy as a "black hole."

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Tethys System transforms data into stars, observing the entire Solaris, and discarded data are cast into the Necrostar.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The abnormal frequency you encountered in the Port City of Guixu is part of it—or rather, it is the Necrostar itself.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Please bring it back to the Modulation Hall, and I shall correct it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Then, the Tethys System will be restored, and harm will be no more.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: My only hope now... is that we are not too late.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Go ahead. I am always with you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Astral Modulator, Guide of Civilizations, Mastermind of the Black Shores... these titles reflect your accomplishments. In the starry underground sky, the Necrostar streaks like a meteor into the distance. The Shorekeeper asks that you retrieve the Necrostar and restore balance at the Modulation Hall.

Dialogues.Speaker: KU-Nana
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If the Shorekeeper places her trust in you, then y-you shall have our trust too.

Dialogues.Speaker: KU-Nana
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Go straight ahead, and you'll leave the Bank of Life!

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Though I am but a projection, I've been by your side all along.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'll stand by you until the very end of this journey.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It appears the Necrostar has been successfully contained underground.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And... the gate is now sealed.

Chapters.Title: Rescue the robots at the Eidoscope

Dialogues.Speaker: KU-Yoyo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thank you! You're doing a good thing.

Dialogues.Speaker: KU-Yoyo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They came out of nowhere!

Dialogues.Speaker: KU-Yoyo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm fine... Give me a hundred more!

Chapters.Title: Defeat the abnormal TDs at the Eidoscope
Rescue the robots at the Charging Station plaza

Dialogues.Speaker: KU-Miro
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Please tell everyone...

Dialogues.Speaker: KU-Miro
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: KU-Miro doesn't just sit and stare at the stars!

Dialogues.Speaker: KU-Miro
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I can fight for our future just like the rest of them!

Chapters.Title: Defeat the abnormal TDs at the Charging Station plaza
Rescue the robots at the Charging Station platform

Dialogues.Speaker: KU-Kadet
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmm, thank you!

Dialogues.Speaker: KU-Kadet
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: After this, let's go help KU-Chan!

Dialogues.Speaker: KU-Kadet
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They will probably need our help over there.

Chapters.Title: Defeat the abnormal TDs at the Charging Station platform
Provide support at the Error Cell

Dialogues.Speaker: KU-Chase
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Have to protect everyone...

Dialogues.Speaker: KU-Chase
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Shorekeeper is doing her best.

Dialogues.Speaker: KU-Chase
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I can't fall behind.

Chapters.Title: Talk to KU-Chase about the situation

Dialogues.Speaker: KU-Chase
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thank you, thank you! You saved the day!

Dialogues.Speaker: KU-Chase
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: These Tacet Discords are such a pain! Luckily, we've got a way to get rid of them!

Dialogues.Speaker: KU-Chase
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: KU-Nana said you have important things to do, right? Go on, then. Leave the rest to us.

Dialogues.Speaker: KU-Chase
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Madame Beatrice and the Agents also need your help.

Dialogues.Speaker: KU-Chase
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Don't worry, we'll keep this station secure.

Dialogues.Speaker: Beatrice
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You're safe. It's okay now.

Dialogues.Speaker: Agent
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I... I heard her voice.

Dialogues.Speaker: Beatrice
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes, she's here. Don't worry, you'll be fine.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm here with you now.

Dialogues.Speaker: Beatrice
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Stay with us, the medical team will arrive any minute.

Dialogues.Speaker: Agent
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I fulfilled my duty... as a member of the Black Shores...

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Your effort won't be wasted. We will restore everything to normal and ensure everyone's safety.

Dialogues.Speaker: Agent
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thank you... Please... Stop them...

Dialogues.Speaker: Beatrice
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We will. Have a good rest now, you've done enough.

Dialogues.Speaker: Beatrice
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Your actions will shine bright like the stars, a beacon for all to see.

Options.PlotLineKey: What happened?!

Dialogues.Speaker: Beatrice
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: An entire Necrostar was forcefully discharged into the Error Cell without warning.

Dialogues.Speaker: Beatrice
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The error codes spilled out as a result. At its worst, it looked a lot like virtual blood seeping through the ground.

Dialogues.Speaker: Beatrice
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We had to seal the underground gate to protect the Control Room. But someone had to retrieve the key...

Dialogues.Speaker: Beatrice
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: He did what was necessary, even if it meant risking his own life.

Dialogues.Speaker: Beatrice
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I admit... I am surprised to see the Shorekeeper here.

Options.PlotLineKey: How's the Agent doing?

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: He is severely infected with abnormal frequencies... It could be fatal.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You and the Shorekeeper finally arrive at the Error Cell where the Necrostar has fallen. However, you find that many of the injured have been severely affected by the corrupted data and cannot be saved.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It appears the Necrostar has been successfully contained underground.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And... the gate is now sealed.

Dialogues.Speaker: KU-Key
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Agents worked really hard to lock that bad star up!

Dialogues.Speaker: KU-Key
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But we have to open the gate to fully control it. I'll get you the key!

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Indeed. With my abilities, you don't need to worry about this.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Though I am but a projection, I've been by your side all along.

Dialogues.Speaker: KU-Key
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We can wipe out all the corrupted data just like we did before!

Dialogues.Speaker: KU-Key
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Use the portals to connect the device and the core, then we'll be in the clear!

Chapters.Title: Clear the corrupted data and head to the lower level

Options.PlotLineKey: Are you alright?

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It might sound abrupt, but... I have begun to sense a change within myself.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: More precisely, it's the part of me that rests in my garden. I feel... something different.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Something... I don't know how to describe...

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's clear that the Agent's condition is terminal.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But still, I lied to him...

Options.PlotLineKey: I'd do the same if I were you.
White lies are necessary sometimes.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I've done this before, by imitating the you I remember from many years ago.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You did what a leader must, but when I looked into your eyes, I could feel it—the emotion humans call sorrow.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Maybe… I should express that emotion in situations like this.

Options.PlotLineKey: You've learned this from me?

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You led the Black Shores with empathy, and it's my responsibility to carry it forward in your absence.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But... I'm currently unable to fully comprehend this feeling.

Options.PlotLineKey: Human emotions are complex.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I see. Well, it is our utmost priority to deal with the Necrostar to prevent further harm.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The only way to achieve this is by bringing the Necrostar to the Modulation Hall and initializing it within Tethys.

Options.PlotLineKey: Gravity caused the destruction of Port City of Guixu.
Does the Necrostar have any connection to the Port City of Guixu?

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This Necrostar is the black hole that destroyed the Port City of Guixu.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: When the Lament struck the city, many were unable to escape and were drawn into the black hole.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The data you brought back is directly related to that event.

Options.PlotLineKey: Is the Black Shores experimenting on the Lament?

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes. You've questioned this approach before.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That's why I aim to change it.

Options.PlotLineKey: How?

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I have the highest access to the Tethys System. Bring the Necrostar to the Modulation Hall, and I'll erase its corrupted data.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Once it's done, Tethys will function as it should, and no one will get hurt again.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But as I mentioned, I'm only a projection without physical form... Could you assist me with this?

Options.PlotLineKey: It feels familiar...
Did I do the same thing 20 years ago?

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm here to help and protect you, just like I always have.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But this time, I will bring everything to a proper end.

Options.PlotLineKey: Let's talk again once we're done with all this.
There are many things I need to understand.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Of course... We have plenty of time for it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Long enough to talk about the past, the present, and the future.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Will you trust me?

Options.PlotLineKey: I don't see any reason not to.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thank you...

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...for everything you've done.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Shorekeeper can sense the underlying emotions feeding into deceit, pity, and other behavior, but struggles to fully understand them. She reveals that the data you recovered is related to the Lament from the Port City of Guixu, and the Tethys System is using the Lament itself to fight against it...

Chapters.Title: Take the elevator to the lower level

Dialogues.Speaker: Beatrice
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Please be careful. The object contained in the center is the Necrostar.

Dialogues.Speaker: Beatrice
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: According to pre-Lament laws of physics, gravity warps the fabric of space and time.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Use the portals to reach the platform.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The voices I hear... They're coming from people in another dimension.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The floating device appears to be made out of Tacetite. It emanates a strange aura.

Options.PlotLineKey: (Reach out your hand)

Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Authorized access, operation confirmed.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hey! Don't just eat whatever's in front of you!

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This looks awful! Ugh, like the worst stew ever made!

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This frequency...

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: W-what are you staring at?

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's the one.

Options.PlotLineKey: The one?

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This frequency has dwelled within you for millions of years...

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'll keep an eye on it. We have more important matters at hand.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Wait, are you saying I'm not important here?!

Options.PlotLineKey: Why did you wake up again, Abby?

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: 'Cause you were about to gulp that hotchpotch of who-knows-what stuff! Go grab something normal if you're hungry. But this? Absolutely no!

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This thing... It's like a dark, spooky hole. Once you fall in, you'll never crawl back out.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Precisely. This is the Necrostar, a black hole that will suck anything close to it into oblivion.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That little creature is able to perceive objects by their frequency...

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Just as it described, the Necrostar's frequency is indeed incredibly complex.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Speaking of which, are you feeling discomfort anywhere?

Options.PlotLineKey: Not at all. The black hole doesn't affect me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No, I'm referring to that creature...

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Do you feel anything unusual when interacting with it?

Options.PlotLineKey: I feel fine.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...That's good to know.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Necrostar's singularity has been retrieved. Let's take it to the Modulation Hall.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'll stand by you until the very end of this journey.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: With the Shorekeeper's assistance, you successfully retrieve the source of the chaos—the Necrostar. Abby, though weary, protests your involvement but lacks the strength to intervene. The Shorekeeper, meanwhile, appears deeply concerned about you and Abby's unique symbiosis.

Chapters.Title: Inspect the info left by the Necrostar
Take the elevator and leave the Error Cell
Take the elevator and leave the Error Cell

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Until...

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...I must keep my promise.

Dialogues.Speaker: KU-Logos
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I think... therefore I am?

Dialogues.Speaker: KU-Logos
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Existence precedes essence—how should one comprehend this sentence?

Options.PlotLineKey: Hello?

Dialogues.Speaker: KU-Logos
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmm, what an intriguing question.

Options.PlotLineKey: Excuse me? Could you tell me where I am?

Dialogues.Speaker: KU-Logos
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ah, my apologies, I was immersed in contemplation and didn't notice you.

Dialogues.Speaker: KU-Logos
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This is Eidoscope, a garden linked to the Tethys System, where the Shorekeeper resides.

Options.PlotLineKey: The Shorekeeper is here?

Dialogues.Speaker: KU-Logos
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well, this is her garden. It's only natural for her to be here.

Dialogues.Speaker: KU-Logos
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Though she often takes the guise of the Sonoro, she has revealed herself recently. It's been some time since I last saw her.

Dialogues.Speaker: KU-Logos
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As for this garden, it's where she assists Tethys' computational analysis in observing the stars.

Dialogues.Speaker: KU-Logos
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ahem, that explanation should suffice. Back to the question now...

Dialogues.Speaker: KU-Logos
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Existence... Hmm, is it real? If it is, what about me? Do I truly exist?

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It appears there's little point in continuing the philosophical debate with the robot.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Perhaps checking on the Shorekeeper is the more pressing matter.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A robot stationed in the Eidoscope informs you that the Shorekeeper has been guarding the Black Shores for the past twenty years. She often conceals herself using her Sonoro, as if anticipating someone's return...

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This is...

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Lament.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It razes cities

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: topples towers

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: crushes civilizations.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Nothing can escape it...

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It sounds the death knell for humanity...

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Leaving billions upon billions of lives lost to its wail.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Despair, obsession...

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Resentment, remorse...

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: These feelings are archived within the Tethys System...

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...alongside the names of each victim.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Grasping desperately for a tomorrow that never dawns.

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But why?

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Why is this burden yours to carry?

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I am the guardian of the Black Shores, the core of Tethys.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I was created for this purpose.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Apologies. I should have controlled my Sonoro vision.

Options.PlotLineKey: Those scenes... they look real.
Have you experienced them yourself?

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I was entrusted to lead the Black Shores in your absence.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's through this duty that I can protect you and what you cherished.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Though I've never witnessed the Lament firsthand, others have shared their experiences with me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I've encoded them into observable stars, enabling the Tethys System to issue Lament alerts.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I am sorry.

Options.PlotLineKey: Why apologize?

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I... should have done better.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This disaster could have been prevented... if only I had been more dedicated to understanding those experiences and emotions.

Options.PlotLineKey: You've done well.
Things could've been a lot worse without your help.
You've saved many lives.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I will give it my all, even if I must sacrifice my Sonoro, or myself...

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
