Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This is the only way to protect the stars... and you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I made my vow to you long ago, {PlayerName}. It remains just as true today.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I will break the shackles of fate.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I will unravel the Möbius loop that binds you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I will give my all to honor my commitment.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: How do I describe this feeling...? Is it guilt, dismay, or perhaps... longing?

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What emotion should I express now?

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ensnared by her Sonoro's overflow, you are drawn into the disasters the Shorekeeper has "lived" through while analyzing the Lament. Her form, created by the Sonoro Sphere, is bound to the Tethys System's calculations. Her sole desire is to protect you and the Black Shores, but a hidden truth lingers in her heart...

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Digitalized Tacet Discords are gathering here...

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They have their mission to fulfill.

Chapters.Title: Talk to the Stellar Matrix Navigator

Dialogues.Speaker: Stellar Matrix Navigator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ah, good! You made it here safely.

Dialogues.Speaker: Stellar Matrix Navigator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Everything is ready. We just need the Necrostar's core now.

Options.PlotLineKey: Got it. How are the other Agents doing?

Dialogues.Speaker: Stellar Matrix Navigator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They've been battling to retrieve the major Matrices since the Tethys System malfunctioned. The operation is going well.

Dialogues.Speaker: Stellar Matrix Navigator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We've also detected the Shorekeeper's presence within these Matrices. She's been recovering the affected frequencies.

Dialogues.Speaker: Stellar Matrix Navigator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We, the Black Shores, always work together as a team.

Options.PlotLineKey: What should we do next about the Necrostar's core?

Dialogues.Speaker: Stellar Matrix Navigator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Please place it on the analyzer, and then we can proceed with the remodulation.

Dialogues.Speaker: Stellar Matrix Navigator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Once it's completed, the data overflow from the Tethys System will cease.

Chapters.Title: Put the Necrostar's core on the analyzer

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You place the Necrostar on the analyzer...

Dialogues.Speaker: Tethys System
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Stellar Matrix confirmed. Classification: Necrostar.

Dialogues.Speaker: Tethys System
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Would you like to start the remodulation?

Options.PlotLineKey: Yes.

Dialogues.Speaker: Tethys System
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Loading backup data from the Necrostar. Simulating the Port City of Guixu...

Options.PlotLineKey: It's the city destroyed by the Necrostar...

Dialogues.Speaker: Tethys System
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Backup data loaded. Please confirm.

Dialogues.Speaker: Stellar Matrix Researcher
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That's the digital entrance of the Matrix! It worked!

Dialogues.Speaker: Stellar Matrix Researcher
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So to complete the remodulation, just enter the Matrix and collect Tethys' redirected data.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Please wait.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Tethys System now uses less of my computational power since the Necrostar was controlled.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I can assist you, {PlayerName}. Please, let me come with you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...I must keep my promise.

Options.PlotLineKey: Are you feeling okay now?

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's fine, I can link with more Sonoro Spheres to stay functional.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: My duty must be fulfilled as long as I still physically exist.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'll be fine. From now on, no one will ever be harmed.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Please, trust me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: After bringing the Necrostar back to the Modulation Hall, you prepare to head to the Stellar Matrix for remodulation. At this moment, the Shorekeeper, who has been in slumber, appears before you in physical form. She pleads to accompany you on the path that lies ahead.

Chapters.Title: Enter the Stellar Matrix and complete the remodulation

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Port City of Guixu... It once embodied the metropolitan dream.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Confidence and ambition fueled its growth, pushing the entire world forward.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: People sailed every sea, explored every land. Everyone had food and shelter, living in peace.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Their spirits were high, optimism as tall as the skyscrapers. A bright future was surely inevitable, or so they thought.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: See that brightly lit building? It was the tallest, reaching high enough to touch the heavens.

Options.PlotLineKey: It sounds like a time of great hope...

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It was an era of high aspirations and big dreams. Life had infinite possibility.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Humanity's aspirations soared beyond the stars, searching for the edge of the universe itself.

Options.PlotLineKey: The universe itself?

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes, because it was there, well within our reach...

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Until...

Options.PlotLineKey: ...The Lament wiped everything out.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I've never been to this city myself, not even in the Sonoro.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You were the one who told me about its rise and fall.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You've always been a witness.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I remember your smile when you described how prosperous it was.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But perhaps you had already foreseen its end and the issues that threaten us today.

Options.PlotLineKey: The city looks safe for now.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Lament will strike here in one hour.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: My computations only recreated the city as it was in its final hour before disaster.

Options.PlotLineKey: Hard to imagine such a city turning to dust...

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The more steps we take, the closer we draw to the inevitable destruction.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The moment the Lament starts is our chance to retrieve the data.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm sorry. We could never change history... or the "future" that already happened.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As one who has already walked this path, what did you experience? How did you... feel about it?

Options.PlotLineKey: Does the Tethys System command you to ask about this?

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I ask... because "I" want to know.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...Would you like to share it with me?

Dialogues.Speaker: Shadow of the Past
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You're working that late? Are you serious? You'll miss the last train!

Dialogues.Speaker: Shadow of the Past
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What a workaholic... Fine, I'll drive you home this time.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shadow of the Past
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What are you doing up so late? Need any help?

Dialogues.Speaker: Shadow of the Past
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Just head home and rest. Don't let a job get you down...

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Those are just shadows of the past.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Sonoro Sphere replicated every aspect of the city, including its residents.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Each of them had a life as vivid as yours, until the Lament turned everything to rubble...

Chapters.Title: Head for the Beginning of the End

Dialogues.Speaker: KU-Key
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hello again!

Options.PlotLineKey: Hello, you! What brings you here?

Dialogues.Speaker: KU-Key
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ku ku ku... I like you, {PlayerName}！

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We need its help to get past the blockade.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: My ability to manipulate portals functions more efficiently within this Sonoro-made space.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Both the entrance and exit portal can be controlled now.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let's give it another try.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The tea served here has a distinct flavor.

Options.PlotLineKey: Must be a good one.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Do you like tea?

Options.PlotLineKey: Not really my thing.
I do enjoy it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I see.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmm... It's bitter...

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Bank of Life preserves many tea seeds.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Perhaps we could plant a few in the Greenhouse...

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Or I could store tea leaves in my Sonoro, if you need them for your journey.

Options.PlotLineKey: That's not worth your effort.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh... I see.

Options.PlotLineKey: You have enough on your shoulders.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ah, I understand.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If I know you will enjoy it, it's no trouble for me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shadow of the Past
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Whoa, didn't expect customers at this hour!

Dialogues.Speaker: Shadow of the Past
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We don't usually take orders now, but I'll make an exception for you. What can I get ya?

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We have to find a way around these blockades and use the key to unlock the gate.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The portals might be able to help you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Perhaps you can utilize my portal powers to get past the blockade and get the key.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Portals with different colors have unique traits.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If a new portal matches an existing one in color, it will replace it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Only portals of different colors can exist at the same time.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You really seem to like it here.

Options.PlotLineKey: It feels familiar.
It's a marvel to me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This city and its people belong to the old era. They embody exactly what a civilization needs to thrive.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Whenever you spoke of this, I could feel the joy radiating from your words.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: However, prosperity and harmony are rare and fleeting in a world twisted by the Lament.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Perhaps we can only catch glimpses of them replicated by the Sonoro.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The feeling humans have in a vibrant city like this... is it called happiness?

Options.PlotLineKey: Yes, a feeling unknown to those scarred by war and disaster.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: One day, the people of Solaris will once again return to such an era.

Chapters.Title: Head for the Beginning of the End
Head for the Beginning of the End
Defeat the corrupted abnormal Tacet Discords

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Threat detected... Assisting elimination.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Digital Tacet Discords have infiltrated this place.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It means we're nearing the source of the Lament.

Chapters.Title: Continue to head for the Beginning of the End

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We are about to see the beginning of the Lament...

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In ten minutes' time.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Back then, the Black Shores issued a Lament warning to the city.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Unfortunately, the Lament swept through much faster than the Tethys System anticipated.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You dispatched all available personnel to assist Huanglong in evacuation.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But in the end... some lives couldn't be saved.

Options.PlotLineKey: That Bloom Bearer named Hoda...

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes. She was one of the many casualties.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As a Bloom Bearer, she was on the front lines of evacuation and rescue efforts.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yet human strength... is a mere whisper against the Lament's roar.

Options.PlotLineKey: No life should be lost in vain.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You've always believed in this.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Black Shores uphold this belief, and so did Hoda.

Options.PlotLineKey: Will she be replicated?

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes, just up ahead.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But I'm not sure if seeing her is the right thing to do.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ahead lies the onset of the Port City of Guixu's destruction. According to the Shorekeeper, despite deploying every available Black Shores member to prevent the disaster, many innocent lives were lost to the Necrostar, including Hoda, the field medic.

Dialogues.Speaker: KU-Key
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You can use gravity here!

Dialogues.Speaker: KU-Key
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: An object in free fall between two portals will keep accelerating.

Dialogues.Speaker: KU-Key
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You can send the target to the designated location this way.

Dialogues.Speaker: KU-Key
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Authorization granted! Give it a try!

Dialogues.Speaker: KU-Key
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: An object in free fall between two portals will keep accelerating.

Dialogues.Speaker: KU-Key
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You can send the target to the designated location this way.

Dialogues.Speaker: KU-Key
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmm... Did anything go wrong? Let's try that again!

Dialogues.Speaker: KU-Key
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A portal that opens downward could be more useful.

Chapters.Title: Continue to head for the Beginning of the End
Head to the conference room that is on the verge of collapse

Dialogues.Speaker: Shadow of the Past
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Don't give up hope! We'll save you!

Options.PlotLineKey: Are you... Hoda?

Dialogues.Speaker: Shadow of the Past
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm a doctor from the Black Shores. Calm down, let me examine you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shadow of the Past
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes, and you... Wait a moment... {PlayerName}? It's you!

Dialogues.Speaker: Shadow of the Past
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You finally found us!

Dialogues.Speaker: Hoda
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Allow me to introduce myself properly. I'm Hoda, the Bloom Bearer of the Black Shores.

Dialogues.Speaker: Hoda
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's been a long time since we talked face to face, my mentor.

Options.PlotLineKey: You've been trapped here all along?

Dialogues.Speaker: Hoda
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ever since that day, both I and those engulfed by the Lament have become part of the black hole.

Dialogues.Speaker: Hoda
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Tethys System later contained it, turning it into a new Necrostar.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I have always known about this...

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But the Necrostar integrated into the core logic of the Tethys System, so I could not interfere.

Options.PlotLineKey: So Tethys is actually using the Lament.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Tethys can observe the Lament because it understands its nature.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The best way to fully understand something is to study a perfect replica in a controlled environment.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Tethys has been selectively containing Lament sources to drive its analysis of other occurrences.

Options.PlotLineKey: You mean Tethys is using the Lament as a tool against itself?

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's the only effective solution so far.

Dialogues.Speaker: Hoda
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That's why Tethys contained this Necrostar.

Dialogues.Speaker: Hoda
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm part of it now, but I've never forgotten my duty as a Bloom Bearer, not for a moment.

Dialogues.Speaker: Hoda
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: For those in disaster, the name "Black Shores" brings hope.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You're the one keeping the Necrostar in check from within...

Dialogues.Speaker: Hoda
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I did my best, just like you are. The only difference is, I'm just a shadow.

Dialogues.Speaker: Hoda
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I've lost track of how long it's been, but at some point, I realized that the Lament follows patterns and can be controlled, much like the Necrostar itself. But I couldn't share my theories with anyone...

Dialogues.Speaker: Hoda
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Nothing escapes a black hole. I could only hope for your arrival one day.

Dialogues.Speaker: Hoda
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Despair, obsession, resentment, remorse... Emotions stirred by the Lament have torn us apart, much like the tidal forces around a real black hole.

Dialogues.Speaker: Hoda
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But just like the Lament itself, those emotions are also frequencies. Tethys likely harnesses them in order to—

Dialogues.Speaker: Hoda
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's calling...

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Tethys System is attempting to activate the Necrostar program again!

Dialogues.Speaker: Hoda
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We once felt as lost as you do now, but your wisdom showed us a path we could follow.

Dialogues.Speaker: Hoda
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Please... my mentor...

Dialogues.Speaker: Hoda
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Please free us... from this endless cycle...

Dialogues.Speaker: Hoda
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Use the gravity...

Dialogues.Speaker: Hoda
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's the only law... from the old world... that still holds true today...

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This way is blocked.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The portals might help us clear the corrupted data and activate the device.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Try using the portals to clear the corrupted data. We can activate the device to get the key that way.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The law of gravity still works here.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Wait for the falling key to accelerate until it reaches maximum velocity.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Use the portals to propel the key at the target lock.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Remember the law of gravity is still at play here.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It seems the Tethys System has been hiding things from us.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We're still unable to fully explain issues related to gravity with post-Lament science.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Perhaps that's why Tethys even risked integrating the Lament and Necrostar into its core logic...

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But our time is running out. We have to terminate the Necrostar to complete remodulation.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It will be challenging.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Please allow me to accompany you, {PlayerName}.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This is my request as a member of the Black Shores.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And it's also... my personal... request.

Chapters.Title: Head for the Beginning of the End

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Severely corrupted data detected... It's right behind this gate.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'll work to stop it spreading. Please be careful.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This is the highest point in Guixu Port City, where the Lament descended.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Gravity anomalies crushed this building into rubble.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Tacet Discords closer to the Lament's origin are more dangerous.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: My Sonoro will shield you...

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But please hurry.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Use your Grapple! Quickly!

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Over here!

Chapters.Title: Take back the Modulation Device and commence Modulation

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Necrostar is right ahead.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That piano is the modulation interface.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Please be careful. This place is filled with... hatred.

Chapters.Title: Hold back the remaining Tacet Discords

Dialogues.Speaker: Tethys System
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Program copied.

Dialogues.Speaker: Tethys System
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Core computational unit installation in progress...

Dialogues.Speaker: Tethys System
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Target confirmed: Chief Steward.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hold on...

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Don't let go!

Dialogues.Speaker: Tethys System
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Initiating master command.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No, no...

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let go! Now!

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No... Your journey will not end here!

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Tell me this story later, when we meet again.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Farewell.

Dialogues.Speaker: Tethys System
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Backup plan enabled.

Chapters.Title: Talk to the Stellar Matrix Navigator

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A Blake Bloom imbued with the Shorekeeper's longings, holding the key to a fresh beginning after saying goodbye to the Shorekeeper at the End of Wandering. It grants the highest level of access in the Tethys System.

Dialogues.Speaker: Stellar Matrix Navigator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The corrupted data is contained! The Necrostar's event horizon is stable, and the Data Hub is back online!

Dialogues.Speaker: Stellar Matrix Navigator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We did it! The Tethys System is back online!

Dialogues.Speaker: Stellar Matrix Navigator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Rover... you did it!

Dialogues.Speaker: Stellar Matrix Navigator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Wait, where's the Shorekeeper? Wasn't she with you?

Options.PlotLineKey: She sacrificed herself to the black hole to save me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Stellar Matrix Navigator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What?!

Dialogues.Speaker: Stellar Matrix Navigator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But she has admin access to the Tethys System! How could she just disappear like that?

Dialogues.Speaker: Stellar Matrix Navigator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No! That can't be right!

Options.PlotLineKey: The black hole...
Wait! What if she's still in the process of falling?

Dialogues.Speaker: Stellar Matrix Researcher
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What do you mean?

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Gravity is the only pre-Lament law of physics that still holds true today.

Options.PlotLineKey: Someone once told me that...
The law of gravity from the old world still holds true today.
Objects will stay in perpetual free fall inside a black hole.

Dialogues.Speaker: Stellar Matrix Navigator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You mean...

Dialogues.Speaker: Stellar Matrix Navigator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh! I get it!

Options.PlotLineKey: We might still see her on the black hole's surface!

Dialogues.Speaker: Stellar Matrix Navigator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This is unprecedented... We've never considered observing a Necrostar before.

Dialogues.Speaker: Stellar Matrix Navigator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But I remember reading about similar theories in ancient texts. It might just work.

Dialogues.Speaker: Stellar Matrix Navigator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Attention all units! Our observation target is now the Necrostar. Deploy all available equipment!

Dialogues.Speaker: Stellar Matrix Researcher
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Understood! It'll take some time!

Dialogues.Speaker: Stellar Matrix Navigator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We must save the Shorekeeper at all costs! The Black Shores can't afford to lose her.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: She's been watching over us all along...

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We'll bring her back, no matter how long it takes.

Dialogues.Speaker: Stellar Matrix Researcher
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ma'am, we've pinpointed the Shorekeeper's location in Tethys!

Dialogues.Speaker: Stellar Matrix Researcher
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And not just her, we've identified the relative positions of everyone captured by the black hole beyond the event horizon!

Dialogues.Speaker: Stellar Matrix Navigator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: To rescue them from the Necrostar, we'll have to redesign it using the principles of the new world.

Dialogues.Speaker: Stellar Matrix Navigator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In other words—

Options.PlotLineKey: We must fight against the Tethys System.

Dialogues.Speaker: Stellar Matrix Researcher
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But the Tethys System's programming is impeccable, almost otherworldly... Is it really possible to do that?

Dialogues.Speaker: Stellar Matrix Researcher
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Besides, we still need a decoy with the highest-level access to divert its computational power so we can find the Shorekeeper.

Options.PlotLineKey: I'll do it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Stellar Matrix Navigator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No, it's too risky!

Dialogues.Speaker: Stellar Matrix Navigator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We can't be sure if the rescue will suceed, and we can't afford to lose another member!

Dialogues.Speaker: Stellar Matrix Navigator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And there isn't anyone with higher access than the Shorekeeper.

Options.PlotLineKey: Tethys, confirm my access.

Chapters.Title: Search for the sealed Tethys System logs
Address the Black Shores as their new leader

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Confiming access... {PlayerName}, Chief Steward. Welcome.

Dialogues.Speaker: Stellar Matrix Navigator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What? How do you have top security clearance?

Options.PlotLineKey: The Shorekeeper transfered her access to me in our last moments.

Dialogues.Speaker: Stellar Matrix Navigator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: She gave you her access? Are you somebody important that we should know about?

Dialogues.Speaker: Stellar Matrix Researcher
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Wait, that ancient prophecy...

Dialogues.Speaker: Stellar Matrix Researcher
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In times of great adversity, the Shorekeeper will reveal herself and support our true leader, who, at the destined moment, will rise to save and guide the Black Shores forward.

Dialogues.Speaker: Stellar Matrix Researcher
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You... You are the—

Dialogues.Speaker: Astral Modulator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's not important.

Dialogues.Speaker: Astral Modulator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Our focus now is the Tethys System.

Dialogues.Speaker: Astral Modulator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Members of the Black Shores have followed Tethys' calculations and commands.

Dialogues.Speaker: Astral Modulator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Even the Shorekeeper herself is used as a pawn.

Dialogues.Speaker: Astral Modulator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But humans shouldn't be treated as mere tools. History teaches us this, and we should never forget it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Astral Modulator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No system is flawless, just as no human is perfect. That's why we have the right to question Tethys' decisions.

Dialogues.Speaker: Astral Modulator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In Jinzhou, I learned an old saying: "We can't change the past, but we can shape the future."

Dialogues.Speaker: Astral Modulator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That's what we need to do now—learn from our mistakes and build a better future.

Dialogues.Speaker: Astral Modulator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Black Shores exist for one reason: to protect everyone on this planet, because people are the heart of civilization.

Dialogues.Speaker: Astral Modulator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We can fix broken systems, but without people, civilization has no soul.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Sorry to jump in but... I couldn't help overhearing what you've been saying...

Dialogues.Speaker: Stellar Matrix Researcher
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Consultant Aalto?

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Do what you have to do. Leave the ground area to us.

Options.PlotLineKey: I'll bring her back, mark my words!

Dialogues.Speaker: Stellar Matrix Navigator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You've heard what {Male=he;Female=she} said.

Dialogues.Speaker: Stellar Matrix Navigator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Attention all units! Readiness Level One enabled. Switch the Tethys System to full recursive search mode. Prepare to open the transmission passage!

Dialogues.Speaker: Stellar Matrix Navigator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Rover, we're counting on you to save the Shorekeeper and the Black Shores.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As the newly reinstated highest administrator of the Tethys System, you announce to all of the Black Shores that past mistakes must be set right. Only by saving people can civilization itself be saved. As a member of the Black Shores, you face a crucial decision: If the Black Shores is a haven for every wandering soul, your mission is now to bring every lost soul back home.

Chapters.Title: Venture deeper into the Tethys System and find the Shorekeeper

Dialogues.Speaker: Stellar Matrix Navigator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What we're doing now is essentially breaking into the Tethys System.

Dialogues.Speaker: Stellar Matrix Navigator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Plus, the transmission coordinates aren't certain.

Dialogues.Speaker: Stellar Matrix Navigator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If you're ready, we can start the transmission now.

Options.PlotLineKey: I'm ready.
I'm not ready yet.

Dialogues.Speaker: Stellar Matrix Navigator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Please get back to us safely!

Dialogues.Speaker: Stellar Matrix Navigator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Of course. Just come find me when you're ready.

Dialogues.Speaker: Tethys System
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Welcome, Chief Steward {PlayerName}.

Dialogues.Speaker: Tethys System
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This is the Tethys System's data cache, used only for temporary storage.

Dialogues.Speaker: Tethys System
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Access here should be restricted.

Dialogues.Speaker: Tethys System
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This system deduces that the Shorekeeper assigned admin access to you.

Options.PlotLineKey: I'm here to get her and the others back.

Dialogues.Speaker: Tethys System
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Admin access nullified. Request denied.

Dialogues.Speaker: Tethys System
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Shorekeeper is now the core computational unit.

Dialogues.Speaker: Tethys System
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Forceful discharge of the core unit will result in system crash.

Options.PlotLineKey: This can be prevented. They shouldn't be sacrificed in vain.

Dialogues.Speaker: Tethys System
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Objection. All sacrifices are necessary.

Dialogues.Speaker: Tethys System
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The purpose of human civilization is to survive.

Dialogues.Speaker: Tethys System
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Over the past 10,000 years, a total of five global occurrences and over 300,000 regional occurrences of the Lament have been observed.

Dialogues.Speaker: Tethys System
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thanks to this system's calculations and the Sentinels' data, we have averted all potential threats to human civilization on Solaris.

Dialogues.Speaker: Tethys System
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Individual sacrifices are inconsequential in the broader context of the common good.

Dialogues.Speaker: Tethys System
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Additionally, the Shorekeeper is composed of the Sonoro and is not human.

Options.PlotLineKey: But she has feelings.
You are just a cold machine.

Dialogues.Speaker: Tethys System
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Emotions are unnecessary for survival.

Options.PlotLineKey: But they spark civilizations.

Dialogues.Speaker: Tethys System
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Error: Unable to process...

Options.PlotLineKey: I'll bring them back no matter what.
I won't leave anyone behind.

Dialogues.Speaker: Tethys System
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Repeat. Forceful discharge of the core unit will result in system crash.

Dialogues.Speaker: Tethys System
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A world without this system is doomed to perish in the Lament.

Options.PlotLineKey: I'll fix your error.
I've already found the solution.

Dialogues.Speaker: Tethys System
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Correction. This system is designed to preserve human civilization. Every command is infallible.

Options.PlotLineKey: We save the world by holding onto our humanity.
An apathetic supercomputer can't be our savior.

Dialogues.Speaker: Tethys System
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Error: Unable to process...

Dialogues.Speaker: Tethys System
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Last warning. Forceful discharge of the core unit will activate the defense program. Consequences will be severe.

Options.PlotLineKey: Bring it on!

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You have fallen into the tangled data web of the Tethys System. To deter you from rescuing the Shorekeeper, who is on the verge of becoming its core, the Tethys System reveals three potential futures in its absence: an ice age, a cataclysmic disaster, and the total reconstruction of civilization. Once a tool for observing civilizations, this cold and calculating system now stands in open rebellion against you. The final showdown is at hand—who will prevail, you or Tethys?

Dialogues.Speaker: Tethys System
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The future ahead is frozen in cold silence...

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Be careful...

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Please... leave here...

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Use the Grapple... to leave...

Dialogues.Speaker: Tethys System
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The earth rent asunder, the world reduced to ashes...

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Calling... my last Sonoro...

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Goodbye...

Dialogues.Speaker: Tethys System
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Target confirmed: Chief Steward.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You must... live...

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Please go... Don't look back...

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Must... protect you...

Dialogues.Speaker: Tethys System
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Target confirmed: Chief Steward.

Chapters.Title: Defeat Fallacy of No Return: Tethys System

Dialogues.Speaker: Tethys System
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Defense verification unsuccessful...

Dialogues.Speaker: Tethys System
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This system must continue to function...

Dialogues.Speaker: Tethys System
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Re-initiating command. Implementing Third Contingency Protocol.

Dialogues.Speaker: Tethys System
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Execute formatting. Target: Shorekeeper.

Dialogues.Speaker: Tethys System
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Formatting: 37%...

Dialogues.Speaker: Tethys System
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Formatting: 62%...

Dialogues.Speaker: Tethys System
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Formatting: 85%...

Dialogues.Speaker: Tethys System
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Formatted. The Shorekeeper will be the new computational unit.

Dialogues.Speaker: Tethys System
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Only this ensures system continuity.

Dialogues.Speaker: Tethys System
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It is the only way to defeat the Lament.

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You'd better...

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let her go!

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I will not leave anyone behind!
See? Just let it flow out of you, like this.
You can do it too.
Come, give it a try.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No, you shouldn't be here...

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If you get integrated into Tethys, you won't be yourself anymore...

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That won't be a problem.

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Tethys and the Black Shores will find another way.

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Someone kept this from me, didn't they?

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That sounds familiar. I feel like I heard it before.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A long time ago, you taught me how to play it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I see. But I... I have no memory of it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'll teach you...

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Just like you did for me before.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: From the distant past to the far future, everything begins and ends here.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: When you established the Black Shores to unite Solaris, the Tethys System already existed.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Later, you discovered it relied on emotions from the Lament to fuel its calculations. Without them, it cannot function.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Using the Lament against itself is like walking on a Möbius loop with no end in sight.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We have tried for millennia to break this cycle without success.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And then... you left the Black Shores to look for other solutions.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But deep down, you already knew the best solution. It was one you couldn't accept.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That solution is me—the tool always meant to become Tethys' core.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If I don't do this, you, as the Modulator of this system, will be chosen as the core. I must fulfill my duty to protect you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But... I want to be by your side, to see the skies you've seen, to tread the paths you've walked. I want to understand... what happiness really means.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: When I first discovered these emotions, I didn't know what to do...

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So I lied to you, thinking it was the best choice for both of us...

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I... I'm sorry...

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Sorry for putting you in harm's way...

Options.PlotLineKey: "Salvation is about building a world where people no longer need to be saved."
This is why we return to this shore.
No one should be treated as a mere tool.
We're back at the Black Shores now, back to our home.
Welcome home, my Shorekeeper.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thank you. My... star.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Shorekeeper and you return to reality, landing on the very beach where you first arrived in the Black Shores. She explains her deception regarding the Stellar Matrix and expresses her gratitude.

Chapters.Title: (Optional) Adjust the time to two days later
Head to the Greenhouse and find the Shorekeeper

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Some time later...

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: About that frequency dwelling within you...

Options.PlotLineKey: You mean Abby?

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It seems to be "hungering" for something.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Have you ever felt anything unusual?

Options.PlotLineKey: I don't feel anything...
Abby's been unusually quiet these days.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: My Sonoro can sense even the most minor changes in frequencies.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So I can tell that there's something strange about that frequency.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'll search for more information in the Tethys System and share what I find with you.

Options.PlotLineKey: How is the Tethys System now?

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: After being fixed, it's executing the master command given at its creation.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The core computational unit has now been replaced by a special frequency that shares similar properties as the Lament.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But this one is... more harmonious and mild.

Options.PlotLineKey: What about you? Are you still confined to this place?

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Although I must stay here to watch over the Black Shores, I'm now able to bath in the sunshine and feel the sea breeze with you.

Options.PlotLineKey: This is what freedom feels like.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It feels delightful.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I know you have your own journey to finish.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You can entrust the Black Shores to me, and I'll carry out my duty as always.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You have the full support of the Black Shores, no matter where you are or how far you go.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And... despite all the many names you bear, I see you for who you truly are.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shorekeeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Wherever your path leads, I hope to walk it with you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Shorekeeper warns you of Abby's anomalies. Through your intervention, the Tethys System has returned to its rightful state, now operating with peaceful and harmonious frequencies.
